actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Federal-State Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 1970 to provide for the use of unemployment rates in the determination of extended benefit periods.

summary.text: Amends the Federal-State Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 1970 to change the measure of unemployment from the rate of insured unemployment, as determined by the number of unemployment claims filed, to the unemployment rate, as determined by the Bureau of Labor Statistics, for the purpose of establishing the beginning of an extended benefit period for receipt of unemployment compensation.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Federal-State Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 1970 to provide for the use of unemployment rates in the determination of extended benefit periods.
